It is a chemical reaction in the fruit or food, amino acids like tyrosine when combined with vitamin C(avocados have both as most food does) and other things they form melanin, melanin turns brown as it comes into contact with oxygen(oxidizes), foods high in formaldehyde like apples turn brown quicker because the formaldehyde reacts with the amino acids and speeds up the melanin production which exposes more of it to oxygen. So the answer is as Nate demonstrated with his mason jar, remove as much oxygen as possible. Personally, I just use oxygen scavengers in the bag with the fruit.

The reason for that is that the process that makes it go brown is oxidisation which is simply the guacamole reacting with the oxygen in the air. So i guess basically the most effective solution would simply be to put your leftover guacamole in a plastic bag, pull the air out and lock the bag.
